etymology.description: 畱(畱) (liú) originally: phonetic 丣(丣) (liú) + semantic 田(田) (tián, "field") -> 留(留) evolved: phonetic 卯(卯) (mǎo) + semantic 田(田, "field") = field-related action -> to stay
etymology.interpretation: The character 留(留) (liú) combines 田(田) (tián, "field"), indicating a place of settlement or work, with phonetic elements 卯(卯) (mǎo) and 丣(丣) (liú) related to staying or remaining. This suggests staying or being present in a field or place.

examples.chinese: 我决定留在学校(我決定留在學校)。
examples.english: I decided to stay at school.

examples.chinese: 老师建议留在班级(老師建議留在班級)，继续提高成绩(繼續提高成績)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī jiànyì liú zài bānjí, jìxù tígāo chéngjī.
examples.english: The teacher suggested staying in the class to continue improving the grades.
